# GitHub Issue Templates

This repository uses GitHub issue templates to standardize how issues are reported and feature requests are made.

## Available Templates

### üêõ Bug Fix
Used when you need to **fix or modify an existing file** in the codebase.

**Title Format:** `Fix: [Brief description]`

**Best For:**
- Changing existing code
- Renaming components/properties
- Fixing bugs in existing files
- Updating text or styling
- Modifying functionality

**Key Info to Include:**
- Path to the file that needs fixing
- What currently exists
- What should change
- Why the change is needed

---

### ‚ú® New Feature
Used when you want to **create a new file or component** that doesn't exist yet.

**Title Format:** `Feature: [Brief description]`

**Best For:**
- Adding new components
- Creating utility functions
- New pages/routes
- New modules or services
- Adding features to the codebase

**Key Info to Include:**
- Where the file should be created
- What it should do
- Dependencies or tech stack
- Example code or reference

---

### üöÄ Project Setup
Used when you want to **generate an entire new project** with full structure and multiple files.

**Title Format:** `Setup: [Project name]`

**Best For:**
- Creating new React apps
- Scaffolding new modules
- Setting up new servers/backends
- Full boilerplate generation
- Multi-file project creation

**Key Info to Include:**
- Type of project (React, Node, etc.)
- Technology stack
- Features/modules needed
- Desired folder structure
- Configuration preferences

---

### ‚ùì General Question
Used for questions or discussions that aren't code generation requests.

---

## How the Processor Uses Templates

When you create an issue with these templates, the **AI GitHub Issue Processor** automatically:

1. **Reads the issue title and description**
2. **Detects the issue type:**
   - üêõ Bug Fix ‚Üí Searches for existing files and modifies them
   - ‚ú® New Feature ‚Üí Creates a new file
   - üöÄ Project Setup ‚Üí Generates complete project structure
3. **Generates code** using Claude Haiku AI
4. **Creates a branch** with the solution
5. **Opens a PR** with the changes
6. **Adds labels** (code-review, ai-generated, bug-fix, etc.)
7. **Sends email notification** to you

---

## Tips for Best Results

‚úÖ **Be Specific** - More details = better code generation
‚úÖ **Include Context** - What's the purpose? Why do you need this?
‚úÖ **Use Exact Paths** - If fixing a file, provide the exact file path
‚úÖ **Add Examples** - Show what you want, not just describe it
‚úÖ **One Issue = One Task** - Keep issues focused and specific

---

## Example Issues

### Good Bug Fix Issue
```
Title: Fix: Rename Home page heading to new text
Body:
  File: src/pages/HomePage.jsx
  
  Current heading: "VI-SUPERMAN Project Management"
  New heading: "VI-SUPERMAN Project Management Tool Generated By VIBOSS"
  
  This text better describes our tool.
```

### Good Feature Issue
```
Title: Feature: Create user profile component
Body:
  Path: src/components/UserProfile.jsx
  
  Should display:
  - User avatar
  - User name
  - User email
  - Edit button
  
  Use Tailwind for styling.
```

### Good Project Setup Issue
```
Title: Setup: Create React + Vite dashboard application
Body:
  Type: React + Vite
  
  Includes:
  - Dashboard page
  - User settings page
  - Authentication
  - Tailwind CSS styling
  
  Tech stack: React, Vite, React Router, Tailwind CSS
```

---

## Need Help?

If the generated code isn't quite right, you can:
1. Create a follow-up issue with corrections
2. Comment on the PR with feedback
3. Manually adjust the PR before merging
